topics.body: I've just realized something legitimately infuriating in mass media; whenever two characters are romantically involved and then the writers axe off one of the main characters to prevent romance.  I'm not talking about whenever it's a tragic romance, but rather whenever the two characters cross the line between friends and romantically involved the writers intentionally axe off one of the characters to prevent any further romance.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554129a66368721fa5921f00#post_554129a66368721fa5921f00
Yeah but Gwen's death served a greater purpose than just killing off a love interest. It was character development for Peter Parker. Showing him the risks involved with being a hero. The death of Gwen Stacy was Spider-man's first real defeat. He had lost someone he loved because he fucked up. It also signified the end of the Silver Age of Comics.
